title: How to Program a Lux Thermostat

steps.title: Open the thermostat and press "reset" with an open paperclip or other small pointy object.
steps.content: Open the thermostat and press "reset" with an open paperclip or other small pointy object. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Set the correct time and day by turning the dial to the "Day / Time" position.
steps.content: Set the correct time and day by turning the dial to the "Day / Time" position. Press "Up" to change the date. Press "Next" to set the time and then use the "Up" and "Down" keys to select the correct time. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Move the dial to "Set Weekday Program".
steps.content: Move the dial to "Set Weekday Program".

steps.title: Decide what temperature you want at various times of the day.
steps.content: Decide what temperature you want at various times of the day. The default heating temperatures are 6 AM - 70ºF, 8:30 AM - 60ºF, 3 PM 70ºF, and 11 PM 65ºF. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Change the start times by pressing "up" and "down".
steps.content: Change the start times by pressing "up" and "down".

steps.title: Press "Next" to set the desired temperatures using the "up" and "down" keys.
steps.content: Press "Next" to set the desired temperatures using the "up" and "down" keys.

steps.title: Continue changing the times and temperatures till you are satisfied with all 4 modes for the weekday schedule.
steps.content: Continue changing the times and temperatures till you are satisfied with all 4 modes for the weekday schedule. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat steps 4-7 for the weekend schedule after turning the dial to "Set Weekend Program."
steps.content: Repeat steps 4-7 for the weekend schedule after turning the dial to "Set Weekend Program."

steps.title: Turn the dial to Run and close the cover.
steps.content: Turn the dial to Run and close the cover. Switch on the "Heat" or "Cool" as appropriate.
